channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: It’s the norm for the Fed chairman and U.S. president to have a meeting—Powell says he’s never asked for a sit down and ‘never will’
item.description: Jerome Powell has fought hard to keep the Fed out of political narratives, and said he would never request a meeting with President Trump.

item.title: Horse Sense: House Republicans work to pass 'big, beautiful bill'
item.description: House Republicans are sorting out the details of the 'big, beautiful bill,' which they say could save up to $550 billion from Medicaid waste and fraud...

item.title: Lone Republican becomes only lawmaker to vote against crackdown on human organ trafficking
item.description: Rep. Thomas Massie was the only lawmaker of either party to vote against an organ trafficking crackdown bill.

item.title: How The Dalai Lama Saw The True Nature Of Chinese Communism
item.description: Despite his spending a lifetime fighting Chinese oppression in Tibet, the Dalai Lama’s new book, Voice for the Voiceless , is a rich source of wisdom ...

item.title: What Is The Point Of Having A GOP Congress?
item.description: What's become increasingly clear is that absent Trump and a few Republicans, the GOP lacks the willingness and ability to govern.

item.title: More than a dozen states sue Department of Transportation over EV charging station funds

item.title: Stay in your lane: Florida AG fires next volley against judge halting state immigration law

item.title: Let them eat cake! French bakeries are protesting because opening on May 1 is (possibly) against the law
item.description: France’s Labor Day bread battle pits bakers’ business needs against worker rights, as lawmakers seek clarity on a centuries-old tradition.

item.title: Trump: 'Major' trade deal coming Thursday
item.description: President Trump teased a "major trade deal" to be announced Thursday, saying there will be more to come.

item.title: From a French village to Meghan Markle’s kitchen: How Le Creuset became the Louis Vuitton of cookware
item.description: Born in a tiny French village, Le Creuset has become a global luxury icon—fired by craftsmanship, cult status, and social media clout.

item.title: An Apple exec’s words took a bite out of Google
item.description: Plus: Netflix's app revamp, OpenAI's Stargate, Amazon's new robot, and Meta's glasses in the latest edition of Fortune's flagship tech newsletter.

item.title: With the Fed in the rearview, stocks jump on signs Trump wants deals with China and U.K.
item.description: Even Bitcoin is back: It was above $99,000 this morning.

item.title: Republicans put California's EV mandate on the chopping block

item.title: The Latin Mass Is a Problem for the Conclave
item.description: It concerns a tiny minority of Catholics, and yet, in some ways, it is symbolic of the biggest debate in the church.

item.title: Report: Biden Pentagon Hid Costs, Injuries Of Failed Gaza Pier
item.description: 'T]he Army and Navy did not meet Service-level standards for equipment and unit readiness,' according to a report from the DOD inspector general.

item.title: Why No One Can Win an Argument with Donald Trump
item.description: Self-assurance carries the day.

item.title: Scott Bessent’s Failed Attempt at Coherent Economic Policy
item.description: The Treasury secretary’s rationalization for Trump’s whims wouldn’t pass an undergrad econ exam.

item.title: Pennsylvania County Sent Voters Wrong Mail Ballots For May Primary
item.description: It is an example of the troubles that plague mail-in voting, and the control county election offices lose when they outsource their work.

item.title: The Fake News Media Come For The Kentucky Derby
item.description: You can't have a healthy society without events like the Derby and the sense of shared heritage that they produce.
